description:
I am using official installation guide for liberty. Everything is fine until I want to luanch the first instance using demo user. The following is the command that I run and the error that I get. I attached the logs in nova-api.log. I can not understnad why "2016-11-10 12:57:53.650 5196 ERROR nova.api.openstack.extensions InvalidSchema: No connection adapters were found for 'http:://192.168.1.247:9292/v1/images/5198dabb-6e54-4d49-a3a0-e678c5974e1c'" happens. It is weired that it is trying for "http:://xxx"; I mean with 2 ":". Can you please let me know how can I solve this problem? http://docs.openstack.org/liberty/install-guide-ubuntu/launch-instance.html#launch-instance ahmad@controller:~/openstack$ lsb_release -a No LSB modules are available. Distributor ID: Ubuntu Description: Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS Release: 16.04 Codename: xenial Running without debug option: ahmad@controller:~/openstack$ nova boot --flavor m1.tiny --image cirros --nic net-id=588f5f89-74c6-48ef-a4d6-a293b7a77f99 --security-group default --key-name mykey public-instance ERROR (ClientException): Unexpected API Error. Please report this at http://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/ and attach the Nova API log if possible. comments.content: Hmm, I haven't seen that before. It's something with making requests to Glance v1 API though, do you see errors in the glance-api logs?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Also might be a misconfiguration with glance somehow, because nova is making a glance v1 request but it looks like glance is returning a v2 response?

"self": "/v2/images/5198dabb-6e54-4d49-a3a0-e678c5974e1c"

What does your nova.conf [glance] section look like, and your service catalog?

What version of python-glanceclient are you using?

comments.content:
Thank you for your response. 
Here is the entires in glance-api after running that command: 

2016-11-11 19:35:18.305 2768 WARNING keystonemiddleware.auth_token [-] Using the in-process token cache is deprecated as of the 4.2.0 release and may be removed in the 5.0.0 release or the 'O' development cycle. The in-process cache causes inconsistent results and high memory usage. When the feature is removed the auth_token middleware will not cache tokens by default which may result in performance issues. It is recommended to use  memcache for the auth_token token cache by setting the memcached_servers option.
2016-11-11 19:35:18.457 2768 INFO eventlet.wsgi.server [req-bd57c566-e2de-47c2-a21d-8a76078701aa 06008100a27c4cf28f5c18920423cf18 3610c619c3c24265a5177e390e98f9e7 - - -] 192.168.1.247 - - [11/Nov/2016 19:35:18] "GET /v2/images?name=cirros HTTP/1.1" 200 879 0.152674

nova.conf [glance]
[glance]

host = controller
api_servers = http:://192.168.1.247:9292

And here it is :(( There is no api_servers in installation guide and I did not notice when I added this with 2 ":" :)) Sorry for taking your time. Now I am getting the following error. Is is familiar for you? 

"2016-11-11 20:12:19.587 3787 ERROR nova.api.openstack.extensions CantStartEngineError: No sql_connection parameter is established"
